name: Virgil's Real BBQ - NYC
address: 152 W 44th St, New York, NY 10036, USA

reviews.text: Cool place to watch sports ğŸˆ  good beer, good food, and good service!
Good spot with yummy food. Especially brisket is melting in your mouth. Spencer is friendly and nice waiter. Ask for him, he will treat you very well.
Delicious fried chicken. Burnt ends were moist , well seasoned.   Our waitress, Daisy,  was attentive and friendly.
We had a great experience on Sunday night. Food was amazing.Our server was Georgia. She was amazing..keep up the great work..

We had a wonderful time at this restaurant! Our server, Agusto, was incredibly kind, attentive, and made us feel so welcome. The service was quick, and he checked on us often without being intrusive. The food was absolutely amazing, everything was fresh, flavorful, and beautifully presented. From start to finish, it was a great dining experience. Weâ€™ll definitely be coming back!

Augusto home of golf but also home of Virgilâ€™s. Itâ€™s like the feeling that I get when I cracked 70 on the golf course that I do with Augusto taking care of me at Virgilâ€™s. celebrated a special night and they went above and beyond with hospitality, a true southern hospitality!
They catered for my corporate lunch and the office was abuzz. Great food and on-time delivery, would do this again!
Live this place

We sat there at happy hour time and we ordered Happy hour snacks one Korean bbq ribs and one sliders and one fried mac and cheese. Korean bbq and sliders were out of this world. Definitely recommended. And the waitress lady was super kind. And the atmosphere is very cool.

We were just walking by Virgil's, reading the menu that was outside, my first morning in New York ever.  A manager came outside and invited us in. We didn't find out until we had already ordered that they were not even open yet. He and our server were incredibly nice, and the breakfast was amazing. Any time I'm in New York I will definitely go to Virgil's!!!!

Place is enormous - if I had known this, I might have looked for a different place. Hundreds of guests served at the same time. Thought the food was good (not overwhelming), price was high for what you get. Single person,  no crazy orders:  70 dollars. Worth it? I don't think so.

(If you get served still water in addition to your drink,  it's a 9 dollar bottle; just that you know  ;-)  )

As group leader and guide for 24 people on a NYC Tour, we had a very successful and enjoyable time, and one of the highlights was the family-style dinner at Virgil's Real BBQ.
I wish to personally thank everyone for their professional and caring hospitality, and I definitely will consider including Virgil's in future NYC trips.
Le service Ã©tait exeptionnelle les plats succulent et une Ambiance de folie tout est rÃ©uni pour une soirÃ©e parfaite ğŸ˜ğŸ”¥
We tried bbq in this place and we enjoyed the food and environment.

My waitress, Shannon, was very pleasant. I ordered the 1/4 (four) Memphis Ribs dinner for $29. I prefer to have ribs with no sauce on them because I want to avoid sugar that is usually in sauce for ribs. The ribs were mild in flavor, thereby not being pleasing enough for me, two of the ribs were very fatty. Two side dishes came with the order, so I chose the beans, which I liked and the potato salad which was ordinary.

Hadnâ€™t been there in quite awhile
Food was decent ,atmosphere Loud!!
Service was great!!
Delicious food, big portions amazing meat and sides. The service was great and I would recommend anyone to order catering through them.
War ok aber zu laut

I give this place a 20/10
Everything about it is so capturing, from the service to the atmosphere, and of course the food! Definitely telling everybody and their mother about this spot!

From the moment we walked in, the service was above and beyondâ€”starting with the hostess. We asked to sit at the bar, but there werenâ€™t two seats together. The hostess went out of her way to ask a guest if she wouldnâ€™t mind moving over, and she graciously did. I eat out often and have never seen anyone take that kind of initiative before.

Our bartender provided excellent service, consistently checking in to make sure we had everything we needed. We also met the manager and had a great conversation with him. Oh, and the food was perfectâ€”with plenty of leftovers to take home!

Apologies that I donâ€™t have anyoneâ€™s names. I had noted them in an email to myself but canâ€™t seem to find it.
Delicioso ğŸ¤¤ excelente opciÃ³n para venir de turismo a time square bbq suficiente para comer y seguir el recorrido. El mejor servicio por parte de Augusto.

The best spot in busy crazy midtown! You have to come in and check out the best at home made menu. They do everything from scratch in the house. Softest brisket, the best deluxe chicken sandwich ğŸ¥ªğŸ— Better than any chick fil a. Ugh and the potato salad it came with! Brian the manager was very sweet to accommodate my needs
Layla the bartender greeted me with outmost best hospitality and she explained everything above and beyond and made me made best choices. I enjoyed my experience here beyond just delicious food but amazing vibe and I felt super seen and welcomedğŸ™€âœ¨ğŸ¥°
Definitely coming back here. And will see them again soon! Want to try everything on the menu.
Frozen margarita looked like the best delicious desert! ğŸ’›

Thanks to our waitress and the manager for helping us get our order in time to catch a bus back to our home town. They could not have been more understanding or helpful in getting us served and supplied with take out containers so we could make or bus. The food was excellent as well, so if you are visiting Manhattan, I recommend going to Virgils.
Busy pricey but worth it.

First time in NY and we found this place.
Omg food is great and we had the ribs as a starter  and they are fantastic.

We went for an after-conference dinner and enjoyed the food, atmosphere, and service. They had something for everyone including GF and vegan. :-) Thanks, Tanya! We appreciated your service and conversation.
Delicious food and happy hour was awesome $5 beers !!! Andrew was awesome.

This was my first time ever visiting Virgilâ€™s and the service alone was amazing! Then the food was sooo incredible !!  I definitely have to go back. I want to highlight my server Shadi, who was honestly the highlight of my visit. He was so empathetic, helpful, and really made sure I genuinely enjoyed my experience. Even the hostess had the most amazing personality and made me feel super welcomed right away. I went during happy hour and the prices were great too! Iâ€™d highly recommend Virgilâ€™s  10/10

This was my favourite place and meal in New York. Enough space between tables, great menu options, good beer selection and advice. Great staff. Just on the corner but away from the big crowds. Loved it.
Ordered two Banana Puddings to go. Be advised itâ€™s not made with pudding. Itâ€™s bananas & vanilla wafers with whip cream as the base instead of pudding.

This restaurant justifies its pricing through quality. The people working here care and take action. I discovered this likable restaurant via Yelp. The meal was extensive, and each dish improved upon the last. I've missed too many opportunities to eat here.

La atenciÃ³n de Shadi  fue increÃ­ble, muy atento, cordial y eficiente. 11/10.
La comida deliciosa y el lugar con mucho ambiente.

A real southern feel in the heart of New York. We popped in passing during happy hour. I had the Korean BBQ ribs, wife had the Brisket Sliders and our son had a 1/4 chicken. The food was to die for. Real scrumptious BBQ! That brisket slider was so good that we ordered a second plate. The food came really quickly too. And the server showed some real southern hospitality. A must eat place in NYC!!
I have been obsessed with their mac-n-cheese for 2 decades!
Hands down the best barbecue place in the world
Stumbled upon this restaurant due to their happy hour prices and will definitely be back!! Tino gave the best service ever! Greatest happy hour in nyc!
Wow, amazing food, amazing service,  amazing atmosphere.

I had to take a moment to write about this place while on my trip to NYC last week.  It was a long day of walking in NYC and I was starving but didn't want pizza.  This place did not disappoint!  Our awesome waiter Spencer took care of us.  I was slightly disappointed at first glance of menu beverages I did not see beef ribs. ( I can't have pork). I asked Spencer if pork was the only option and he happened to mention that there was a special that today of a handful of beef ribs that were smoked all night. He went to ask chef if there were any left and omg there was. Without hesitation I said.. I'll take it.  Then I asked well how many ribs come in an order (expecting to hear 2-3) nope he said one. One weighing about a pound and half maybe. Sure I'll take it.  Omg ... this one beef rib was the best. It just fell off the bone, the meat was the most tender meat ever!!! It just fell apart in your mouth. I chose sauce on the side but honestly, sauce was not needed it was so damn good! 10/10 for me. Worth every penny!!!!!!!  Thank you Spencer!!!!!  Please make sure to to tell chef again .. it was the best Beef Rib I've ever had!!!!

I grew up in Texas and my family lives in Oklahoma. We were so pleasantly surprised that the BBQ was excellent! We sat upstairs where Tino was our bartender/server and had a blast. Excellent food, beyond excellent service, and reasonable prices. Highly recommend!!

My friend and I shared a half rack of ribs, which were tasty.
It came with 2 sides, we chose the cheese grits and the brussel sprouts. Loved the brussel sprouts, cooked with lots of oil and salt. You can also choose from french fries, sweet potato tots, collard greens and more.
They have 3 BBQ sauces on the table, mild, hot and jalapeno mango. I liked them all.
The service was good.

They have TVs all over the place with sports playing.

A good choice if you're in Times Square seeing a show.
Sehr leckeres Essen, aufmerksamer Service, nahe am Time Square

Siamo stati oggi per provare il vero bbq americano e devo dire che hanno soddisfatto a pieno le nostre aspettative! Il cibo Ã¨ davvero ben fatto e di ottima qualitÃ , lâ€™ambiente Ã¨ perfetto e il servizio ancora meglio! Nota di merito per il cameriere Tony davvero bravo!

Uniche due note di demerito: il cibo arriva giÃ  un poâ€™ troppo freddo, che Ã¨ peccato per la carne. Inoltre lâ€™aria condizionata Ã© troppo forte e il cibo si raffredda davvero velocemente. Da valuta un tagliere in pietra caldo o comunque abbassare lâ€™aria perchÃ© fa davvero freddo. Salutiii

Food was very mediocre; I got a brisket plate with Brussels sprouts and sweet potato tots. The brisket was dry and way too salty, Iâ€™ve had much better brisket from home and from food trucks. The Brussels sprouts were mushy and bland. The sweet potato tots were fine. I was let down because the hostess recommended the brisket and Brussels sprouts, saying they were the best two items in the menu.

My mom got burnt ends which were dry and salty, and my dad got a pulled pork sandwich- which he said is easily the worst pulled pork heâ€™s ever had. It didnâ€™t have a meat texture, it was more like pork paste.

The service was not very good. The waiter went around the table to take orders but skipped me and left, I had to order after everyone else. Then as we had questions they werenâ€™t super helpful, and after asking multiple times if we could split the bill they ignored our question and just gave us one whole bill.

This place makes even the devil cryğŸ‹
A faire sans hÃ©siter pour manger typiquement amÃ©ricain !
Great place. You get tons of food with each order.

What a nice place!
The brisket is delicious
Near Times square but out of the crowd
The dirty rice very nice too
And the Mac and cheese too
I had left there my phone and they day after they gave it to me
Very nice staff
I had Miguel as Walter, very nice with a perfect Pina colada!!!!

We popped into Virgilâ€™s Real BBQ in NYC and had a fantastic, no-fuss BBQ night. I had the BBQ Burger and my wife had the half chicken â€” both knocked it out of the park.

The BBQ Burger was everything you want from a proper BBQ joint: the patty was juicy with a great crust, a pleasant smoky note and just the right amount of seasoning. It wasnâ€™t drowning in sauce â€” instead the BBQ flavors complemented the beef, so each bite tasted rich and well-balanced. The bun held up, the texture was spot-on, and it was deliciously messy in the best possible way.

Her half chicken was equally impressive. The skin had a beautiful char and crispness, while the meat underneath stayed unbelievably moist and tender â€” you could tell it was cooked with care. The smokiness came through without overpowering the natural chicken flavor, and the seasoning hit that sweet spot between savory and slightly tangy.

Service felt friendly and relaxed; our server checked in at the right moments without hovering, and the food arrived hot and at a comfortable pace. The atmosphere is casual and lively â€” exactly what you want for a laid-back BBQ meal. Portions were generous, so you definitely get your moneyâ€™s worth.

All in all, Virgilâ€™s delivered on both classics we tried. If youâ€™re in the mood for straightforward, well-executed BBQ, this place is a solid pick â€” weâ€™ll be back.

Nao gostei muito da iluminaÃ§Ã£o escura, fica difÃ­cil ver o cardÃ¡pio, fora isso, super recomendo, pode ser turistico, mas todos nÃ³s somos.

This was my first time back at Virgil's after many years and they did not disappoint. We stopped by right before a show (after a day of food tour downtown) and ordered nachos with brisket and sweet potato tots... both were delicious! The nachos was huge in size... had good size brisket chunks and generous serving of guacamole too. Server was super friendly also. We'll definitely come back next time were near Time Square.

Everything about this place was exceptional. The service and the food could not have been better!

Shadi and Lannie could not have done enough for us, were incredibly attentive and massively helpful with explaining different dishes to us and pointing out their recommendations, not to mention selflessly offering us another drink without hesitation every time they noticed us with near empty glasses.

At the end when they provided us with the bill, they even gave us our hush puppies starter on the house as a guest goodwill gesture!

The food was by far the best we have eaten on our trip to New York, the Surf n Turf in particular was one of the best meals I've ever eaten.

Shadi and Lannie, keep doing what you're doing, you made our dining experience the best we could have possibly asked for and we will absolutely be returning in the future!

Our choices:

Hush Puppies

Surf n Turf (Shrimp Skewer and Skilet Steak with Chimichurri Sauce) with Mac n Cheese and Sweet Potato Tots

Beef Brisket with Mac n Cheese and Mashed Potatoes with Gravy

This is a banging spot in NYC. It is close to Times Square so can get very busy very quickly so you may have a wait at times. But itâ€™s worth it, the BBQ menu is great, every dish I have ever tried has been incredible from sandwiches to wings to brisket, they know what they are doing with slow roasted meats and bbq.
The own brand sauces are a great side dip for most of the dishes.
Loads of cocktails and beers available and happy hour prices in the week.
The staff are super friendly and welcoming and they never leave you with an empty glass even when itâ€™s busy!
Trust me visit them if you are in town you wonâ€™t regret it!
Fomos para um jantar, comida boa e ambiente legal!! O garÃ§om estava um pouco sem paciÃªncia mas de resto foi uma delÃ­cia! Tenho algumas alergias e foram super atenciosos comigo! Recomendo!

We were there with 5 people. The BBQ was ok but not overwhelming. I already had significantly better food. I bothered me that there were hardly any vegetables. We were also at the table without water, we had to order it separately. The waiter was very friendly, he made the best effort, but unfortunately he was hardly understandable with a mask. Unfortunately I wouldn't go there anymore. We paid $ 285. We wait for food less than 10 min....,,
Everyone can form an opinion for themselves

Unfortunately, our recent visit to Virgilâ€™s was disappointing from start to finish.

Environment & Service:

Upon arrival, the air conditioning was not working. Staff acknowledged this and asked us to wait at the bar for 30 minutes until it was fixed. At the bar, we had to flag down the bartender just to get service. Once seated, it took about 10 minutes before our server came to the table. Although Restaurant Week (July 21â€“August 17) was being advertised, we were told it was no longer being offered.

Menu Issues:

Several items were unavailable due to the restaurant reopening after renovations. This included chili, collard greens, and hush puppies.

Food Quality:
Overall, the food lacked seasoning and flavor. Many dishes felt incomplete or poorly executed.

What We Ordered:

Starters:

Brussels Sprouts â€“ Oily, unseasoned. 3/10
Burnt Ends â€“ Fatty, lacking seasoning. 5/10

Entrees:

Beef Brisket â€“ Dry, fatty, unseasoned. Burnt ends were better than the brisket itself. 4/10
Fried Chicken (Hot Daveâ€™s Style) â€“ Overly sauced; sauce covered up unseasoned chicken. Portion size was generous. 5/10

Sides:

Cheese Grits â€“ Watery, unseasoned. 4/10
Biscuits â€“ Average. 5/10
Mashed Potatoes & Gravy â€“ Real potatoes used (skin present), but unseasoned. 6/10
Dirty Rice â€“ Moist but bland; brisket mixed in was the same unseasoned meat. 5/10

Overall Impression:

The restaurant felt disorganized operationally, with service delays, unavailable menu items, and bland food across the board. At this time, we donâ€™t plan on returning.

After walking all over NYC, I was thrilled to see a barbecue place near my hotel. Big mistake. We sat at the bar at Virgilâ€™s, and I ordered a steak. What I got wasâ€¦ honestly, I donâ€™t even know if Iâ€™d call it steak.

The first one looked like it had been boiled, waved past a grill for 2 seconds, and then left under a heat lamp. Raw on the outside, shoe leather on the inside. Sent it back, got another. Slightly more grill marks, but still tasted like chewy mystery meat that had no business being served to a paying customer. Easily one of the worst steaks Iâ€™ve had in my entire life.

The â€œsidesâ€ didnâ€™t help. The rice was so overcooked you could finger-paint with it. And bonus surprise: little rancid beef chunks hidden in there like landmines. The mac and cheese was the only thing that didnâ€™t taste like a health code violation â€” but even that was barely passable.

If the health department walked in, I think theyâ€™d just lock the doors and call it a day. Virgilâ€™s should be embarrassed to call this food barbecue.

Furthermore, the one bathroom is in the back by the kitchen. So you have to stand at the bathroom door while you look directly into the kitchen. I witnessed a guy opening a drawer on the left side of the kitchen that looked like it had chicken in it, Iâ€™m assuming itâ€™s a warming drawer to keep things hot, but he dropped his rag on the floor that he was using to clean stuff and he picked it back up and started wiping the area where the chicken was. He literally picked the chicken up with his dirty hand, wiped the container with this rag that has just been all over the floorâ€¦ I mean, it doesnâ€™t get much worse than this.

I dropped over $100 on this disaster, and for what? To watch floor-rag chicken prep and eat the worst steak in Manhattan? Honestly, I shouldâ€™ve just lit that hundred on fireâ€¦. at least then I wouldâ€™ve gotten a little warmth and a better smell for my money.

Perfect happy hour weekday 3~6pm.
Sliders beef brisket or pulled pork.
Less crowded than before. Same management as Carmine.

Quite an institution yet BBQ not as popular as before as menu with too much salt and spices. Classier than Dallas BBQ but not as

We visited in March while in New York, and my wife and I had a great experience. From the reception to the waitress, the service was excellent. The food was absolutely deliciousâ€”we highly recommend this place and will definitely be coming back soon!

I must confess that I don't associate NY with barbecue, but it was my first time in the US and I had to try a nice BBQ in NY since I was only staying there. And oh boy, I don't regret it! Texas BBQ experience in NY. The brisket is so tender and juicy! The pork ribs are so tasty ğŸ˜‹ the Mac and cheese and the fries are too very good garnishment. Is it the most awesome BBQ in the US? Probably not... Can it kill your cravings or curiosity for a good BBQ? Absolutely! Friendly staff also!

Prenotato per cena giÃ  dallâ€™Italia per assicurarci un posto. Personalmente ho mangiato bene un ottimo cheeseburger. Ambiente affollato e tavoli un poâ€™ troppo vicini lâ€™uno allâ€™altro. Servizio buono e personale gentile. Al tavolo il tovagliolo Ã¨ un asciugamano vero e proprio, sensazione un poâ€™ strana ma ok. Sempre serviti i classici bicchieri dâ€™acqua e ghiaccio (fa un certo che le prime volte per noi italiani). Costi standard per NYC tenete sempre conto delle â€œfamoseâ€ mance al personale.

Sam was such a lovely waiter - love you Sam! Manager also came to check if we were all good. Such good care.

The food was pretty okay and drinks even better. I was starving so I didnâ€™t do my usual video aha.
Dipped in here after a broadway show on our way to Grand Central. The BBQ chicken nachos were amazing! Loved the high roller margarita! Special shout out to our server Tony, he was fantastic!

Virgilâ€™s
152 W. 44th St.

Hush Puppies
Pig Out

The hush puppies served with maple butter are basically fried corn bread.  Itâ€™s a perfect appetizer to accompany your main course.  The irony is you wonâ€™t really need this appetizer because their main course alone will fill you up, but thereâ€™s always room for leftovers.

The pig out is a fantastic deal.  Itâ€™s basically equivalent to the cost of 2 entrees.  you are served every meat along with two sides.  This will also be great for leftovers!

As you indulge, donâ€™t forgot to take advantage of their barbecue sauces.

#virgils #theaterdistrict #nycfoodie #barbecue #pigout #hushpuppies

We were pointed to Virgil's from Carmines after there was a 3 hour wait there, and boy was i pleased with the suggestion! The service there was impeccable our server made two suggestions for me which tasted amazing.
First off was the Cat fish. Something I'd never tried before but was happy to try and I'm so glad I did.
It was such a nice, well cooked white meat fish. The chips were great and the muffin thing that came with it was both tasty and confusing.
The second recommend plate was the Key lime pie, again a first and it was gorgeous, so soft and full of flavour.

I visited again my last day for a pulled pork sandwich and again was not disappointed. The blue moon beer too is also a good option after a day of walking round NYC

I highly recommend this place for some Good american dinning.
Atmosphere was also great in the evening with the sports on the Big screens. Everyone chatting and enjoying
What more could you ask for.

There was even a job advert in the window. If I had a working visa I'd have applied
